channel.title: CVE Feed for Tenable -- Nessus Agent
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Tenable -- Nessus Agent

item.title: CVE-2024-3291|2024-05-17T16:59:56.144Z -- Tenable -- Nessus Agent
item.description: When installing Nessus Agent to a directory outside of the default location on a Windows host, Nessus Agent versions prior to 10.6.4 did not enforce secure permissions for sub-directories. This could allow for local privilege escalation if users had not secured the directories in the non-default installation location.

item.title: CVE-2024-3292|2024-05-17T17:17:14.470Z -- Tenable -- Nessus Agent
item.description: A race condition vulnerability exists where an authenticated, local attacker on a Windows Nessus Agent host could modify installation parameters at installation time, which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code on the Nessus host. - CVE-2024-3292

item.title: CVE-2024-2390|2024-03-18T15:37:44.698Z -- Tenable -- Nessus Agent
item.description: As a part of Tenableâ€™s vulnerability disclosure program, a vulnerability in a Nessus plugin was identified and reported. This vulnerability could allow a malicious actor with sufficient permissions on a scan target to place a binary in a specific filesystem location, and abuse the impacted plugin in order to escalate privileges.
